    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(int suit,
    int rank)
        The contstuctor accepts two integers to set the rank and suit of the card. If the rank given is invalid, the card is set to an ace. If the suit given is invalid, the card is set to hearts.

    • Method Detail

      • getSuit

        public int getSuit()
        The getSuit method returns the suit as an integer value. 1 is Hearts. 2 is Diamonds. 3 is Clubs. 4 is Spades.

      • getRank

        public int getRank()
        The getRank method returns the rank as an integer value. 1 is Ace. 11 is Jack. 12 is Queen. 13 is King. Any other number is the number returned.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        The toString method returns the suit and rank of the card as a string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Card otherCard)
        The equals method tests to see if two cards have the same rank.
        Parameters:
        otherCard - The card that is being compared.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Card other)
        The compareTo method returns a positive int if the card has a higher rank than the card argument. Returns a negative int if the card has a lower rank than the card argument. Returns 0 if the cards have the same rank.
